comments:
Build ID:  M20060921-0945

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Use the update manager to find updates for EMF or any plugin that depends on EMF
2. Select Eclipse or any other mirror.
3. The following error is consistently being returned:

Network connection problems encountered during search.
  Unable to access "http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/".
    Unable to access site: "http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/" [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/.]
    Unable to access site: "http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/" [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/.]
  Unable to access "http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/".
    Unable to access site: "http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/" [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/.]
    Unable to access site: "http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/" [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/.]
  Unable to access "http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/".
    Unable to access site: "http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/" [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/.]
    Unable to access site: "http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/" [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/.]


More information:

http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/ is deprecated, but there's no way to tell Eclipse that. Your best bet is to return to the EMF website and check the new location for the UM site, which is listed here:

http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/updates/ (note the new "/modeling/" part)

So, the new UM site is:

http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/updates/ (site.xml, site-interim.xml)

Starting with next week's builds, EMF will list the new UM site in its features, so the old link will no longer be referenced.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Starting with next week's builds, EMF will list the new UM site in its
> features, so the old link will no longer be referenced.

Does this mean that the problem will solve itself automagically next week, or is some manual interaction required to update EMF on existing installations?

You'll have to manually add the new URL(s), or install a new version of EMF from downloaded zip which as of this week's build should have the new URL in its features. After that, it should just update as it's been using the new URL. 

The new URLs are of course:

http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/updates/site.xml (releases)
http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/updates/site-interim.xml (I, M, S builds)

The link from the "Requirements" section of the WTP 1.5.2 download page (http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/R1.5/R-1.5.2-200610261841/) is also broken.

This is causing problems for at least some folks; see the 'newcomer' newsgroup.  

I understand moving to a different site structure for ongoing work, but I'm confused as to why it is necessary to break already-released (1.5.2) versions?

The web is fluid. Links change. That's why I have landing pages which always allow you to find what you need. That said, I don't expect to have to refactor entire web trees very often; this should be a one-time pain.

As to broken links to EMF from other projects, there's not much I can do about that except to ask them to update their links to be dynamic and to link through our downloads page rather than to static pages. This also improves download performance since you, the user, gets EMF from your nearest mirror instead of from download.eclipse.org.

A couple of projects have already been hit with bugs about these bad linking practices, such as WTP and TPTP, but haven't fixed the problem yet.

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=164519
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=164523

What I can do, however, is to make old paths in /tools/emf/ bounce you to the downloads page in /modeling/emf/downloads/ so you can from there find the latest compatible version of EMF, rather than getting a 404/403 error.

(In reply to comment #5)
> What I can do, however, is to make old paths in /tools/emf/ bounce you to the
> downloads page in /modeling/emf/downloads/ so you can from there find the
> latest compatible version of EMF, rather than getting a 404/403 error. 

Done. archive.eclipse.org and download.eclipse.org now have index.php redirector pages for old releases of EMF, such as:

http://archive.eclipse.org/tools/emf/downloads/drops/2.0.4/R200509300951/ (works)
http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/downloads/drops/2.2.1/R200609210005/ (should work once mirroring across the nodes is complete)

I have the same problem as other have mentioned here. Not sure if the redirect should resolve this, but it does not. I can't edit the install/update location/site "Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF) Updates".

Sites using export:

  Unable to access "http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/".

Well, there's not much I can do about the ajdt problems, but I can set up a redirect in /tools/emf/updates/ to bounce you to /modeling/emf/updates/, which should be working in about 20-30 mins after the nodes mirror.

Please replace the existing URL (or disable it, or ignore the errors) and use instead this URL for the EMF Update site:

http://downloads.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/updates/

As there's nothing I can do to fix an old version of EMF, you'll have to update to a newer version using the new URL (or by downloading a new zip). Once you have that, you will have the correct URL listed.

I am just trying to do a simple update via Help | Software Updates | Find and Install | Search for updates of the currently installed features for my 3.2.1.  This goes well until it gets to EMF and then it aborts (see below).

This is keeping me from getting other updates.

This issue is apparently _not_ fixed as it has been marked.

I cannot fix the update site for EMF as the Edit button is disabled.  It is also disabled for several others and there is no way to get rid of them or fix them.  Others are editable.  I don't understand the difference.  One of the disabled ones I know is broken.  Perhaps all are.  But I repeat that they cannot be removed.  This may be another problem but it is owing to a broken EMF site.

The redirect mentioned below is apparently not working.

It is not good when development changes affect working versions.

What I get is similar but not exactly the same as already posted.  (It looks as though there is still a problem with the site.)  This is what I get:

Unable to access "http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/".

Reopening so I can once again explain the solution here...

Deprecated / obsolete / no longer available:

http://download.eclipse.org/emf/updates/site.xml (releases)
http://download.eclipse.org/emf/updates/site-interim.xml (I, M, S
builds)

New URLs (linked from the EMF website, at http://www.eclipse.org/emf/ -> click Updates):

http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/updates/site.xml (releases)
http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/updates/site-interim.xml (I, M, S
builds)

You'll have to manually add the new URL(s), or install a new version of EMF
from downloaded zip which has been updated with the newer URL.

Thanks for the information, but I am confused.  How do I manually add the new URLs.

The update manager won't let me edit the update site that probably has the old update URL.  (I can't even see the URL it uses.)  The Edit button is grayed out.

I definitely don't want to use a ZIP.  That destroys the whole benefit of the update manager.  I have a large Eclipse installation and do not want to have to manage all the pieces individually, nor do I think that is the Eclipse intent.

I mainly want to get this fixed so I can get other updates.  Failing on EMF terminates the whole looking-for-updates process.  The mechanism is designed so you search for all of them, either via Find and Install | "Search for updates of the currently installed features" or Manage Configuration | Scan for Updates.  Your change is screwing it up.

Also I do not think this should be labeled "Deprecated / obsolete / no longer available" since it is needed for the current working release.  I think the implications of your doing this are more extensive than you realize.

Sorry if I am appearing belligerent.  This is a pain in the butt.

Thanks for your time.

     -Ken
Second Kenneth Evans, Jr. previous comment. I have the _exact_ same problem - cannot use edit to change the URL of the existing EMF update site and I, also, have a big Eclipse install.

Can't you uncheck the offending site, and add a new one? Here's a walkthrough for adding a new remote site to UM: http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/docs/misc/UsingUpdateManager/UsingUpdateManager.html#step1b

Bear in mind that doc hasn't been updated to point to the new URL, so the example given shows the OLD UM site, not the new one.

Hi,

     It's very easy to add a new one.  I am probably getting EMF through Callisto, now anyway.  The problem is that you can't delete the old one. And the update mechanism wants to use all of them, aborting when it gets to the old EMF one.

     I submitted this as a bug (#154442) a long time ago.  For some reason one of my own updates sites made it unhappy after switching to 3.2.  I (and my users) couldn't get rid of it short of reinstalling Eclipse from scratch.  The only reply was that it _must_ have been my fault, ignoring the real bug, which is that you can't remove it.  Maybe you have more influence in these matters.

     Given that they won't fix it, it would seem that you should make sure yours works right -- what I had to do.  "right" in this case means "doesn't cause problems".  What you have done _does_ cause problems, whether it "should" or not.  And even if they fix it, the fix won't help now.  I would like to finish my update.  Also, I am not having trouble with other projects, just EMF.  The update sites are "supposed" to handle new versions.

     BTW adding a new site or using a ZIP, as you suggested, probably won't fix the problem.  The problem is most likely with the old update site that uses the old URL that you have eliminated.

     -Ken

(In reply to comment #15)
>      It's very easy to add a new one.  I am probably getting EMF through
> Callisto, now anyway.  The problem is that you can't delete the old one. And
> the update mechanism wants to use all of them, aborting when it gets to the old
> EMF one.

I usually have about 6 UM sites listed, but only update from 2-3 of them at a time. Just disable the ones you don't want to use (uncheck them).

Meanwhile, I've updated the feature.xml files in EMF 2.2.2 (EMF 2.3 was updated a couple builds ago) so next week's build will have the new UM URLs, in preparation for Callisto 3.2.2 due in a couple weeks. I've also copied this week's UM site from its new home (/modeling/emf/updates/) to its old home (/tools/emf/updates/). I trust that should resolve this problem. I'll continue to copy the site into both places until after Callisto 3.2.2 is released. After that, updates will only be available at the new URL.

Thanks.  That allowed my update to finish.  (I note that I ran it several times and it continued to install updates for Eclipse Project SDK and J2EE Standard Tools each time, so there is something wrong there, but that is another issue.)  The problem that caused me to contribute to this bug seems to be fixed.

It doesn't seem to matter wheteher they are checked or not.  (I only have one checked.)  Using the two procedures I stated above, the most obvious ones, it does all of them.  These are obviously shortcomings in the update system, but I have found that group unresponsive.

If I get a chance, I can try to figure out out to hack the configuration files to get rid of the bad ones.

(In reply to comment #17)
> If I get a chance, I can try to figure out out to hack the configuration files
> to get rid of the bad ones.

Unpack the feature jars, edit the feature.xml files to remove or correct the incorrect URLs, repack the jars, and restart Eclipse. You might have to run with -clean in order to for it to notice the changed jars, or you might have to start w/ a fresh workspace (I'm not sure how much is cached). 

Glad you were able to update - sorry for the undue pain in the a$$. ;-) I'll mark this bug verified since you're satisfied.

(In reply to comment #16)
I'll continue
> to copy the site into both places until after Callisto 3.2.2 is released. After
> that, updates will only be available at the new URL.

Am I missing something?  It seems to me that updates need to be available at the old location for as long as the old versions that point to that location are in the field, that is, essentially forever.  Otherwise it seems you're requiring people to update to a newer version in order to be able to update to a newer version, and that makes no sense.

(In reply to comment #19)
> Am I missing something?  It seems to me that updates need to be available at
> the old location for as long as the old versions that point to that location
> are in the field, that is, essentially forever.  Otherwise it seems you're
> requiring people to update to a newer version in order to be able to update to
> a newer version, and that makes no sense.

Sorry, what I meant was EMF 2.0.x/2.1.x/2.2.0/2.2.1/2.2.2M/2.3(to M4) will be available at the old location. NEWER versions (2.2.2R, 2.3M5+) will be accessed at the new site. For the case of 2.2.2R, that one will have to be cross-posted to both the old and new site (to catch people who only update from release to release, rather than grabbing Maintenance updates from site-interim.xml).

So... if you have 2.2.1, you'll be directed to the old site, get your update to a version that's got the new URL in it (2.2.2), and from that point onward, you'll update from the new site.

In the event that there's an update available for 2.0.x or 2.1.x, I'll post it to both the new and old sites, in order to allow old clients to update to the new software AND get the new URL in the process. 

In short, everyone can update from the old URL, but once they do, they'll have a version of EMF that includes the new URL in its features.
That sounds perfect.  Thanks for the clarification.

FYI:

EMF 2.0.6, 2.1.3, 2.2.4, and 2.3.1 have been released to the new update site with their features fixed to update from that new site too.

http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/downloads/?project=emf
http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/updates/

EMF 2.4.0 (still in development) is also available from the new site.

BTW, another solution to 'I can't update because the update site is 403'ing' is to use a local (or remote) policy file to force features to look somewhere other than their default update site.

http://wiki.eclipse.org/Testing_Pre-Release_Builds_Via_Policy_Files
http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/emf/updates/policy.xml
